summary: The Safe Transit Accountability Act (S. 2945) amends Title 49 of the United States Code to clarify the role of the accountable executive in resolving disputes within a transit agency's safety committee. The bill designates the accountable executive, responsible for the Public Transportation Agency Safety Plan and the Transit Asset Management Plan, as the final decision-maker regarding safety recommendations. This includes the authority to implement or reject risk-based mitigation strategies and to act as the tiebreaker in committee disputes.
